ygData.subject: Re: rez question
ygData.msgSnippet: No actually what i meant is that there are certain lvls that are harder to get XP in, you will see this as you get higher up, for example, lvl 30, lvl35, lvl40
ygData.messageBody:
No actually what i meant is that there are certain lvls that are harder to
get XP in, you will see this as you get higher up, for example, lvl 30,
lvl35, lvl40 lvl 45, all of these levels seem to take forever to earn the
necessary Experience, i think they are set up that way for a reason, to try
to slow us down...that is why i say if you res a person in those specific
level they will not see as noticeable a difference as a person who is in
another level.

Bree Wyndsdale
34th Cleric of Fennin Ro
-----Original Message-----
From: Azor <jmaynus@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, July 06, 1999 11:42 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] rez question


>From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
>
>I think what she was saying is it depends on what Lvl the person you're
>casting it on is on. Like since I'm still lvl 15 (should hit Lvl 16
>sometime today), if casted it on me I would not get much exp back but if
you
>casted it on a played say that was Lvl 45 they'd get a good bit back.
>So I take it you finally got you one of those Staff of the Observer you've
>been wanting forever. Hope you like it and congrats on Lvl 40. Why is Lvl
>40 gonna suck by the way? Is it like Lvl 20 when ya die you lose close to
a
>bubble of exp? If thats why then I guess on Lvl 40 you what lose close to
>two bubbles of exp?
>
>**************************
>Azor
>Lvl 15 Human Cleric of the Rathe
>**************************
>
>
